Reviews.Content: We loved Hotel Scoti! We stayed in many places during our trip to Italy but Hotel Scoti was by far our favourite. Central to everything but really quet. Gorgeous peaceful rooms, great location and very reasonble rates. Could not find fault with this place. Our host Doreen did everything she could to make us feel at home. We felt like we were her only guests (although the hotel was full!). We loved everything about Hotel Scoti.
Reviews.Author: LouisaMelbourne

Reviews.Content: Great location but... My 21 year old son  I stayed four nights in a double room (twin beds) in the Annex at the Scoti. At 110 Euros per night I must admit I was disappointed in the size of the room - we couldn't move around and were tripping over our bags. The room  bathroom were well cared for and very clean but we had a glitz on our second morning when we had no hot water to shower - apparently due to faulty maintenance the previous day. The location is great - walking distance to everything so you could come  go during the day if you wanted to drop off shopping, etc.We didn't have breakfast in our room as there was really no space butwe found a great place on the corner of Piazza della Signoria (Loggia on the right) where we had breakfast every morning  often detoured to drop by during the day- great coffee, fruit salad, panini, pastries  gelati.
Reviews.Author: AussiePam47

Reviews.Content: great location we stayed 4 nights at hotel scoti in september. the location is unbelievably good - very close to everything we needed (train station, galleries, restaurants  bars)doreen was great - very helpful  friendlywe had a double room with ensuite. the room was large  the bathroom was great. our only complaint would be that the room we had was very noisy - everytime someone spoke in that hotel we could hear it, luckily we had packed earplugs as everything else was great
Reviews.Author: theyipster

Reviews.Content: Florerentine Charm We stayed at the Hotel Scoti for 5 nights with our 2 children. We stayed in a large, quadruple room with en suite, which was simply furnished and extremely clean. The hotel was easy to find due to the clear written instructions provided by the most hospitable, Doreen. The hotel is in a fantastic location, within walking distance of all the major tourist sites, the market and station. It was a little noisy one night, due the late arrival of some guests and friday night socialising, however this was a minor inconvenience, given the location, cleanliness, hospitality and charm of the hotel.
Reviews.Author: Pipingshrike

Reviews.Content: Excellent Value! We stayed in this hotel for 4 days in May 2007 and loved it. It is a walkable distance to all the major attractions and is right in the middle of all the shopoing Florence has to offer. A cab from the train station would cost around 10 euros. The hotel staff were very helpful and we had a great time.All in all, considering the price, this is excellent value. Cannot get better.
Reviews.Author: love_travel11

Reviews.Content: Best hostess ever!!       Our Room - Number 11
Reviews.Author: maudsters

Reviews.Content: Hotel Scoti - a great value in a perfect location My husband and I stayed at Hotel Scoti a few years ago, so it was an easy decision to stay there again in 2008. A few blocks from the Uffizi and the Arno, the hotel is on the 2nd floor of a 14th century palazzo.Doreen and Carmelo are perfect hosts. Breakfast in your room is available. Some of the travel books indicate only shared baths. NOT True. All of the rooms I saw had baths ensuite.We have stayed in a room both on the street side and the rear side of the hotel. Both were fine, but If street noises bother you, request a room on the back.
Reviews.Author: NancyCA

Reviews.Content: Great Little Scoti Hotrel Scoti is in a superb location, central to everything in Florence. The wife of the owner team, Doreen, is a gem, she can't do enough for you, and is anxious to answer any questions you may have - if you forget your Florence tour books, she can provide all the information you need. The rooms are big, clean, and comfortable, if a bit spartan. The entire lobby/reading room has an old fresco of the pastoral Tuscan countryside - very homey and welcoming. The hotel is on the 2nd floor of a large old palazzo and the entryway off the street is through a huge old wood door, then an entryway with a frescoed ceiling. The elevator is teeny (max 2 people and 1-2 bags) but moves expeditiously. This is a great choice - very quiet and friendly. We'll stay here again on our next stay in Florence. It would be a challenge for those with disabilities due only to the small elevator.
Reviews.Author: jscooper36

Reviews.Content: Location,location,location We've recently returned from a one week visit to lovely Florence and our second stay at the Hotel Scoti. The hotel is located less than a ten minute walk from the train station and is an equally short distance to major tourist sights such as the Duomo , Piazza della Signoria and the Uffizi Museum. It's an even shorter walk to the Arno River and the interesting sites on the other side. The hotel shares their street with a number of high end retail shops and the Strozzi Palace which is now a museum featuring rotating exhibits. Our rooms at the hotel were not fancy. They were, however, large, immaculately clean and with a comfortable bed. The host/owners, Doreen and Carmello live on the site and go out of their way to make your stay enjoyable. Doreen is bilingual and from Australia. She loves her adopted home of Florence and is most friendly, knowledgeable and helpful. We'd certainly recommend the Hotel Scoti and can't wait to return. (Incidentally, the price shown for the hotel on Tripadvisor may be in euros rather than dollars)
Reviews.Author: Bretharte

Reviews.Content: Hotel Scoti--a good choice I stayed at Hotel Scoti in late March. I originally selected this hotel because I saw the owner Doreen was Australian and I thought English communication would be smooth and efficient. It was and all went well when I booked my room about two months before my trip toFlorence. Doreen was very nice and helpful. As I had questions throughout my stay she was always there with good information and then double checking to make sure all was going well. The room was a bit bland but the building and common rooms were interesting. The entire place was spotlessly clean and our bathroom was modern and nicely appointed. The alleyway noise was a bit loud at times but I felt like I had booked a hotel in the middle of the city and the noises I was hearing were city noises. This hotel has helpful owners, very good and safe location, and had a budget friendly rate and therefore a good value.
Reviews.Author: RedsoXfan8

Reviews.Content: Large room Hotel Scoti is in a convenient location, but can be difficult to find. Here are some tips to make it easier. It is located on the second floor of a large building and does not have it's own entrance. Look for the tiny plaque with a buzzer on the outside. Once inside the building, you can take the elevator or stairs to the second floor. The elevator says that it can accomodate up to 3 people, but I barely felt safe riding in it by myself. If you take the stairs, look for the light switches on the walls or you will have to walk in the dark as it is not always lit. Also it is more like walking up 2 stories due to the high ceilings in this building. Although this hotel has an elevator it is not wheelchair accessible. After taking the elevator you still have to walk up a very short flight of stairs to get to the hotel door.Once inside the hotel we were surprised by the size of the room, it was large and there is also a common living room with couches and a beautiful mural. The bathroom had recently been updated, and had a great shower. On the door of the room it indicated that this hotel is a 1 star establishment. You can definately tell that it is when you see the plain, sparce decor in the room. We were awoken both nights that we stayed by noise from outside our window. One night it was a loud argument at 3 am, another night loud music. Needless to say, bring earplugs if you're a light sleeper.The host of the Hotel, Doreen speaks impeccable english and can give directions and suggestions for nearby restaurants and shopping.
Reviews.Author: coffeegirl247

Reviews.Content: Great Location The best thing about Hotel Scoti is its location. Florence may be an easy city to wander around in but I still felt that being based on Via Tornabuoni and closer to the river rather than than near the train station was the way to go. It was so convenient to just skip a few blocks back to my room to drop something off or pick something up and then be back on my way again. I knew I was in for one-star hotel standard but as a solo traveler, staying for 5 nights, the 75 euro a night represented good value. I wasn't in my room much so I was more interested in staying somewhere that would be a good base for me while in the region of Tuscany. To that end, Hotel Scoti didn't disappoint. Doreen and Carmelo were very helpful and made sure my stay was an enjoyable one. My single room was basic but very clean and spacious and traffic noise was not an issue and the breakfasts for 5 euro extra were great. I had a brilliant time in Florence and Tuscany and Hotel Scoti served my purposes perfectly.
Reviews.Author: AndrewP_72

Reviews.Content: good location but... good location, 10 mins walk to the train station. but the hotel is located at a quite terrible building (for me).....probably it's a historical building it's a only one-star hotel.....not a 3/4 star hotel that you may seen somewhere....but the host is very friendly and the washroom is newly decorated...but the rate I think is not much worth. the reasonable rate I think should be euro70-80 when comparing to other hotels.
Reviews.Author: rat22

Reviews.Content: Great place to stay The location was fantastic, very trendy area amongst very expensive shops. Loved the huge door to the building! We walked to all the sights easily, including the train station, which is how we arrived.Huge room and nice bathroom, all very clean and tidy. Lovely common-area sitting room. Lots of character. Doreen was very friendly and helpful.I have recommended this hotel to many friends and clients (I'm a travel agent) and would happily stay here again!
Reviews.Author: Jo_Kiwi

Reviews.Content: Fabulous! Chose Hotel Scoti from Lonely Planet. Have to admit that the Australian connection via Doreen was an initial attraction, which proved to be spot on as Doreen is a gem. So friendly and helpful, and could not do enough for us. We loved the location, a short walk from railway station, right in the centre of things, a short walk to Uffizzi, the Duomo, all our favourite cafes, the Ponte Veccio etc. We loved our room, it was comfortable and spacious, with a great view of rooftops, and very nice bathroom. Also a very quiet location even though in the centre of things. it was great being on the best fashion street in Florence, the shop windows were unbelievable! We mostly had breakfast out at Gilli on Piazza de la Republica, which was fun, but one morning had the special breakfast on a tray in the room, and it was lovely. Probably would have preferred to have a breakfast room, but as yet they dont have this facility. There is a lovely sitting room with the most beautiful frescoes. Nothing but praise for this great little hotel, and would / will definitely stay there again.
Reviews.Author: gabrielli

Reviews.Content: Depends... If you are just looking for a place to crash at night and take a shower in the morning and not pay much this is not a bad place to stay. However, on arrival Doreen was not particularly friendly and snapped at us for knocking on the door as I had not seen the buzzer but at once changed her tune when she realized we heard what she said. We were there for 3 or 4 nights and each time we walked through the main living area and passed her husband and said hello, Buon Giorno, anything to him...not once did we get a response from him. We began to feel like we were imposing company instead of paying customers! So all in all we didn't get warm fuzzies staying here and would look elsewhere if we returned to Florence.
Reviews.Author: ecbox21

Reviews.Content: extremely pleased We were extremely pleased with our stay with Doreen. We had room # 6, while our friends had room #7. Both rooms and baths were clean and fairly spacious, and the double beds were comfortable. Street noise was never a problem, although the numerous steps to the second floor (3rd floor in USA) can be challenging if you dislike the elevator. Wewould very definitely return to Hotel Scoti.
Reviews.Author: JanetWP

Reviews.Content: Great place A friend of mine who is a licensed tour guide in Florence recommended Hotel Scoti and we loved it. It's in a terrific neighborhood, close to all the big attractions and the price is very reasonable. The furnishings are simple but comfortable. The property is very clean and we had a large room with gorgeous new bathroom. The hotel serves a nice breakfast for a little extra. The owners are cheerful and helpful. Highly recommended!
Reviews.Author: Yabolo

Reviews.Content: Living above Prada This charming little hotel is right above Prada and directly opposite Cartier. We stayed for 3 nights in a room in the Annex. The owner Doreen was very friendly and accommodating to all our requests, even offering to get us hot water for our little baby when needed. The room and attached bathroom are clean and seem to be renovated recently.The hotel is near to all the major sights in Florence... just a few minutes walk to the Duomo. It is within walking distance from the train station if you carry only a backpack. However, if you have more luggage, it is advisable to get a cab.
Reviews.Author: reds99

Reviews.Content: Charming! What the hotel Scoti lacks in 5star luxury it makes up for in old fashioned Tuscan charm. If you want a plasma screen TV, power shower and bar serving cocktails this isn't the place for you.However, if you are looking for good value, friendly staff, a fantastic location, antique furniture and frescos on the walls this place hits the mark. The staff couldn t have done enough to help and everyone we met who was staying there seemed truely charmed.
Reviews.Author: heather_p23

Reviews.Content: everything the reviewers before us said is true This place is hard to beat for location, cleanliness and hospitality. Well situated a few blocks from the train station and the Arno River and extremely well worth the price at 115 euros. But its best asset may be its proprietor, Doreen, who not only speaks fluent English and Italian but goes well out of her way to assist in making reservations, checking times, addresses - even doing your travel web research for you. She saved us a 30 euro cab ride by informing us that there was an early shuttle to the airport for only 5 euros. The place is clean and quite spacious all things considered. Plus, we were able to leave our bags at the hotel during an interim bike trip through Tuscany. You really feel that you are not alone in Italy. Highly recommended from someone who can be quite critical.
Reviews.Author: philandcarolyn

Reviews.Content: Great location and tiny elevator       our room
Reviews.Author: kimz92684

Reviews.Content: Spacious clean quiet room with execellent location Stayed there 1 night while visiting Florence. Loved the location, space and quietness. Paid 105Euro for the night. Old fashioned elevator was quite interesting. We enjoyed staying there and would go back. (since Florence is well worth a few days of time)
Reviews.Author: NayKat

Reviews.Content: Great little hotel, but no bar! This is a really nice hotel, centrally located near all the sites, but just out of the way enough not to feel crowded or noisy. The rooms are spacious, clean and comfortable, and the owner, Doreen, is friendly and helpful. She checked train and bus times for me, and recommended some nice restaurants.The only downside from my point of view is that there's no bar or cafe, so you can't get a coffee or a beer - you have to go out for everything. It would have been nice to be able to get a beer and hang out with some fellow travellers occasionally. Not that that's a big problem, as there are lots of nice places nearby!
Reviews.Author: LondonGuyLondon

Reviews.Content: Loved it This is a gem of a hotel, fab location, full of character without any of the usual downsides that having character normally implies. Comfortable rooms, very clean, a lovely lounge area  pleasant hosts who were quietly welcoming. We really loved our 1 night in this hotel  wished we'd stayed longer ( avoided the over crowded  tawdry Cinque Terre.) Can think of no negatives, if you're going to Florence - stay here.
Reviews.Author: Reyn0lds

Reviews.Content: Great Value This a great value hotel with a great location. We stayed at the annex overlooking the Via de' Tornabuoni. There was no air conditioning in the room we stayed in but provided with a fan. Overall, we enjoyed our stay here and would recommend it to everyone.
Reviews.Author: si_pooh

Reviews.Content: great location, great hotel We stayed in this hotel in the center of FLorence for the first few days of our honeymoon. We had read some positive reviews, but we still not sure what to expect, however, we were delighted with what we found. THe hotel is siuated right in the centre of Florence, from which you can walk anywhere in the city. The hotel itself is lovely. The rooms are of a good size, and impeccably clean. The hotel is housed within a very old builidng, and have the character to match - the main reception room has the most amazing artwork covering the walls.The owner is incredibly friendly, offering lots of advice if you need it. I could not have hoped for a better place to stay in florence, and would definetely stay there again should i ever return.
Reviews.Author: ewanclaire

Reviews.Content: Fabulous location My husband and I stayed with Doreen and Carmello for 4 nights.Our room no 5 was spotless with a newly renovated bathroom.Doreen was an informative friendly host who also booked tour tickets for us. Her valuable advice was greatly appreciated. We loved the homely atmosphere of Hotel Scoti and it's central location. We walked everywhere during the day and at night. We will return again and have recommended Hotel Scoti to friends.
Reviews.Author: LadyCapeTown

Reviews.Content: Frescoed Sitting Room Very clean, well located hotel. It had a lovely frescoed sitting room. Dorene was very pleasant and gave us the name of 2 excellent restraunts nearby. We stayed in the annex where you could hear a lot of traffic noise which could possibly be a problem if you were a light sleeper. We would be very happy to stay there again.
Reviews.Author: CorkIrishtravellers

Reviews.Content: Great little hotel My wife and I stayed at Hotel Scoti for 5 nights.Clean and comfortable. Walking distance to everything. Doreen was wonderful.Would we stay here again? YES!
Reviews.Author: rb99

Reviews.Content: good location and owners The location was good a few blocks from restaurants but close to shops. Definately within walking distance to major attractions. The hotel was beautiful but finding your way there from the train station was a little confusing. Our room was large with a very nice bathroom. The owners were nice and helpfull. Overall a great first time experience and price in Florence.
Reviews.Author: lisamWashington

Reviews.Content: Absolutely wonderful       Bathroom
Reviews.Author: Elpheba

Reviews.Content: Staying here = saving money to drink more wine!!! We have actually stayed at Hotel Scoti twice so far, once in October and once in November. My husband and I both absolutely love it. First, you can't beat the price. It was around 105 Euros per night, not bad for Florence. The rooms (we've had two different ones so far) have both been quite large with a standing armoir... closet. The room was quite clean, however, a bit sparse. Our goal was just to have a place to drop our bags while we went to the bars/restaurants of Florence. For that, it was perfect. The bathrooms were pretty spacious as well. (They provide soap but you'll want to have your own shampoo/lotion/etc) The hotel (the reviewer who said hostel was probably correct, although, I've never stayed in one) is a little older read: the place is not bright and shiny). The views over the tile rooftops are really nice. It's on the 3rd floor of a building, so, you can either take the stairs or the lift. There is breakfast for 5 Euro, but, we've never eaten it. The hotel is on an expensive shopping street, but, still very close to the Duomo (7 mins walking), Ponte Vecchio sp? (7 mins walking) and restaurants/bars. In fact, it's right down the street (5 mins?) to the Antinori wine bar. (Which by the way was quite tasty. Get there early or make a reservation) Long review short - not that that's possible at this point - it's a great, minimalist hotel for those who don't need a lot. OH! And the owners are great. They even loaned us a couple of travel books when we left ours at home the first time we were there. They are very friendly and are ready if you need them but not in the way. You get a key when you get there and can let yourself in and out at your leisure. The next time we're in Florence, we'll be staying here again.
Reviews.Author: TravelDealer

Reviews.Content: Great place and fantastic helpful host!! We stayed at the Hotel Scoti for 4 nights in late November. Great place, location and price. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The bathrooms were especially nice since they obiviously had been recently renovated. Fantastic host! We booked the hotel via emails to the hosts Doreen  Carmelo. They promptly answered emails and were able to accomodate our date changes. Upon arrival we were greeted by a staff member and when asked she provided great recommendations for restaurants and cafes that were just around the corner from the hotel (all in less than a 5 minute jaunt). We took daytrips to Siena and San Gimignano from Florence. Doreen (owner/host) sat with us and made great recommendations on how to get there and provided us with bus schedules, advised us about transfer points and drew maps with landmarks so we could travel with ease. Doreen is Australian so it was very helpful that she and her staff spoke english. We spent nearly three weeks in Italy on this trip and this hotel was definitely a great choice for this segment of our travels.
Reviews.Author: Karen--VA

Reviews.Content: you get what you pay for Hotel Scoti is not a great place to stay in Florence. Firstly the name is misleading - its not a hotel at all the place is really a hostel. It was obviously the apartment of a very rich family at one time and the decor has the depressing air of faded grandeur about it. The rooms very basic and are not the kind you would want to spend any time relaxing in.The bed sheets were not changed once during our 4 day stay and neither were the towels Every day we came back to find our used towels which we had left on the floor carefully replaced on the radiators! The first morning we all woke up having been bitten during the night - we searched high and low for mosquitos but did not see or hear any -i have never experienced bed bugs before so I can't be sure what it was that was biting us but it was not mossiesThe location is not great really either -there are no cafes or restaurants on the street but granted there are plenty within a 10 minute walk. The street is all very expensive designer shops and lets face it if you are staying at Hotel Scoti you probably cannot afford to shop here. We stayed in an expensive hotel for 6 days in Rome and decided to economise by staying some where cheaper in Florence - big mistake!!Sure the family who run the place are friendly but we did not see them from the time we checked in til we left 4 days laterFlorence is a beautiful city so do not ruin your experience of it by staying at the Hostel Scoti you could probably find somewhere much better for very little more cash
Reviews.Author: strawberryjellybean

Reviews.Content: Great Stay at Hotel Scoti!       Via Tornabuoni, looking towards Hotel Scoti (on right)
Reviews.Author: crs319

Reviews.Content: Excellent location and value This hotel was wonderful. It is very reasonably priced and very well located..about a 5-10 minute walk from the Uffizi and Ponte Vecchio, and also very close to the Duomo. Doreen is a helpful hostess, and her fluency in English makes life quite a bit easier. The room we stayed in and its bathroom were spacious and very modern. The breakfast, at 5 Euros each and served in the room, was very reasonable (a croissant, a danish, and another bread, coffee/tea/milk, orange juice, and some packaged toast). Eating at the hotel saved us the time of looking for a place to eat in the morning before our museum reservation times.The only drawback was that we heard a good deal of noise from scooters speeding down the street at night. However, I don't think any hotel could have protected us from that.Doreen's restaurant recommendations were also very good - look into Dante and La Spada - both very good options.I would definitely stay at this hotel again.
Reviews.Author: ReallyEnjoyTraveling

Reviews.Content: return trip as good as the first i stayed at Hotel Scoti in 1997 and returned in 2006 and was just as pleased. it is on the fanciest shopping street in Florence, Via Tornabuoni in a building built in 1440. the main greeting room has frescos on the walls and ceiling from 1770. Doreen is a wonderful host, she and her husband live in the building and she was extremely helpful in advising us on how to get into the Uffizi without tickets. the room accomodations are simple, but clean and comfortable for a tourist who doesn't want to spend long in their room. the frescos and building are just beautiful, so even though the room is more plain, it's worth it. it's up a big staircase, but there is a TINY elevator that barely fit 2 people and 2 suitcases, but did the trick for the initial trip up.
Reviews.Author: mannlaurie

Reviews.Content: A great place to stay! I stayed at the Hotel Scoti for five nights at the beginning of October and wouldn't hesitate to go back. Doreen and Carmelo were the perfect hosts and couldn't do enough for you while you were there. They recommended the best places to eat when we arrived - one for every night we were there! (make sure you book to eat in il Latini when you are there which is just around the corner from the hotel! the food and experience is brilliant - thank you Doreen!) The hotel is located on a very up market street, next to Prada and opposite Cartier, on the second floor of a building. Our ensuite room was large with twin beds and had all the basic things you could need for a short stay. The sitting room is beautiful with floor to ceiling frescoes. All of the major sites are no more than a 10-15 minute walk away, with the Duomo and Piazza della Repubblica (which leads to The Palazzo Vecchio and The Uffizi) about a 5 minute walk! We arrived by train which is an easy 15 minute walk.I would highly recommend the Hotel Scoti and would definately stay there again!
Reviews.Author: chaela104

Reviews.Content: Hotel Scoti is an excellent choice Having been to Florence many times in the 1980s, I knew we wanted a central location and a quiet night's sleep, two concepts which, in Florence, can be mutually exclusive. With a strong Euro, we also needed a good value. Unlike many of the less expensive accomodations in Florence, Hotel Scoti is located in a central location on Florence's most fashionable shopping street, Via Tournabuoni. The location put us within not more than a 5 minute walk to most of Florence's attractions on both sides of the Arno, as well as the train station. Located in a 16th century palazzo, the hotel is the only one in its buiding, unlike some buildings that have a pensione on every floor, so the building is a peaceful place. The website reccomends requesting a room on the inner courtyard for a quieter night's sleep, so that is what we got. The hotel has been recently rennovated and our room had a nice bathroom w/shower, very clean. The owners, Doreen and Carmelo, could not have been nicer or more accomodating. They were available whenever we needed them and were helpful in suggesting options for dinner , etc. It has been my experience that Florentine hoteliers have alot of pride in what they offer and standards are overal pretty high, but I think Hotel Scoti was an especially good value. Hotel Scoti is not a luxurious place, but it fit our needs perfectly, making our stay in Florence memorable.
Reviews.Author: Polyxena

Reviews.Content: Wonderful for those new to Florence My partner and I spent two days at the Hotel Scoti in mid-September and can only echo the positive comments of other reviewers. The common areas of the hotel are charming, the rooms are clean and comfortable (a little spartan, but that's what we expected), the location is great for any first time visitor to Florence who wants to see the main sights, and the breakfast, while more expensive than a capuccino and croissant standing up at an Italian cafe, was cheaper than anywhere else we stayed. The highlight, however, is the proprietor Doreen, who was without a doubt one of the nicest, most helpful people with whom we dealt while in Italy. She gave us directions, made several helpful suggestions about things to see and places to eat, and seemed genuinely interested in making the acquaintance of everyone who stayed at the hotel. Before we arrived she or someone else at the hotel also made us a reservation at the Uffizi, and offered to make dinner reservations if we wanted to eat at an upscale restaurant. All of this for 95 euros per night for two people (with a private bathroom).Two final notes: First, several other reviews mentioned noise in some of the rooms facing out towards the main street. We had one of these rooms, and it was our experience that if we closed the window the noise didn't wake us up in the morning (and the weather was cool enough so that this was not at all uncomfortable). Second, the only qualification I might make is that the neighborhood of the hotel is VERY touristy, even for Florence. Most of the restaurants in the hotel's immediate vicinity cater to foreigners, and the entire experience can start to take on a bit of a theme park quality. Were we to come again, we might try for a slightly more far flung neighborhood in order to get a bit more of a feel for the real city. But for first time visitors, or anyone who simply needs an economical, friendly place to stay, the Hotel Scoti is tops.
Reviews.Author: DanW329

Reviews.Content: A bargain for the heart of the city Hotel Scoti is across the street from Cartier on the fashion strip of Florence. It's a five minute walk to the Ponte Vecchio and all the attractions are certainly within walking distance. We had a clean room with a very clean washroom and it was great for the price. We didn't experience any noise as did other reviewers but I guess it depends on the room you get. For the price, you can't go wrong. I would definitely go back. We slept and showered and then were out discovering. Hotel Scoti served it's purpose.
Reviews.Author: FabioD

Reviews.Content: Oasis in the city I can heartily the Hotel Scoti. My brother and I stayed in a spacious twin room, en-suite, with a view over the back roofs across to a tower (church , we suspect : see below) for 105 Euros a night, which we reckoned was very good value. Breakfast is available, in a rather fine room for (I think) 5 Euros, but it is not compulsory and we did not have it.The Hotel Scoti is located in Via Tornaboun as part of an old palazzo, two floors up. There is a lift, which I recommend you use, at least until you get used to the stairs, which are not always on at night, and you need to know where the switches are.Via Tornabouni is in a rather swanky street. The hotel itself is located next door to Prada and across the street from Cartier. However it never felt busy and we never heard traffic in the room. It is about five to ten minutes walk from Santa Maria Novella railway station,and only a few minutes from Piazza della Republica and the Duomo.Your hosts, Doreen and Carmelo, were most welcoming. My brother and arrived in after 11pm but we had warned them in advance and Doreen was waiting for us. Thereafter they were always happy to see us and to check if there was anything we needed. The beds were perfectly fine. Shower, handbasin, toilet and bidet.The only thing I would warn you about is that the room had no air-conditioning. To be honest I prefer this because the drone keeps me awake, and I woulkd rather use the perfectly good windows and shutters. However the first night, a Saturday night, was a very warm evening so we left the windows open. However this meant we we awoken first of all by the dawn chorus - the Scoti is near the Arno and so not far from the swarming starlings , and then at 7am the church bells started to ring, and not just seven times for 7am, but about 35 sharp peals. Once you know about it you can deal with it, and it is hardly the fault of the hotel, but be aware.If, like us, you want a serviceable place to sleep in safe, friendly surroundings, as opposed to paying for the grander but often faceless hotel experience, then the Hotel Scoti will do you very nicely. Five stars, with ease.
Reviews.Author: Jakies_Abroad

Reviews.Content: Better for a short stay We went to Hotel Scoti after staying in a very relaxed and fun Casa Astarita in Sorrento. We found Scoti very formal and lonely for a long stay. No chance of mingling with other guests in the elegant sitting room. Everyone crept around and kept to themselves. The dining room was beautifully furnished but eating was not permitted there. We would have loved to have had the chance of eating in occasionally. Even a cup of coffee would have been nice.
Reviews.Author: suzanmuzza

Reviews.Content: A little gem in the heart of Florance We had an exceptionally comfortable 2 night stay at the Scoti. The room was very quiet with absolutely no noise from ajoining rooms. Our room faced an inner courtyard so there was very little traffic noise.The bathroom was immaculateDoreen was charming and friendly and made us feel as if we were the only guests.I would recommend this hotel without reservation except perhaps in July and August when I consider airconditioning is a must in all southern european cities Would I stay there again ?....absolutely..I wouldn't consider anywhere else in Florence !The situation of the Scoti is unbeatable..it is convenient for everything and everywhere.
Reviews.Author: Braithsan

Reviews.Content: A great hotel I chose the Hotel Scoti after looking at the reviews on Trip Advisor. The hotel is an excellent place to stay.  I traveled with my Father and my 2 kids, ages 16 and 11. Our family had 2 rooms. Both were spacious and very clean. Since we knew the hotel is on Via Tornabuoni (a busy street) we asked for rooms away from the street. Noise was no problem for us.Doreen is the best hostess in the world! Always very helpful, no matter what you needed...from reservations, to maps, to recommendations. Breakfast at 5 Euros is a great deal.The location could not be better. Walking distance from everything!I have to agree with other users concern about no AC. However, we were there in June and the nights were cool, so that was no problem.
Reviews.Author: msague

Reviews.Content: Good choice except for summer We stayed in Hotel Scoti for three days in May and would agree that the Doreen is a great host. She cheerfully made reservations for us at museums and restaurants and was very available to answer questions. She is Australian and her whole family speaks English so that facilitated making arrangements. The stone building and high ceilings keep the rooms cool, so the fan in our room was adequate for May; I agree that keeping the window open would be too noisy. The location is very upscale, same street as Tiffany's and across from Cartier. Easy walk to museums and restaurants. A taxi to the railroad station they arranged for us for very early in the morning was on time. (We had worried about getting our train to Rome in time for our flight back to the US.) This hotel would be our choice for future visits, except for summer.
Reviews.Author: Geneva101

Reviews.Content: Great Location and Wonderful Host But beware After much research my Wife and I settled on the Hotel Scoti for our 4 night stay in Florence. We paid 105 euro per night and did not opt for the breakfast. Too may bars in Florence to get pastries and coffee. My emails to Doreen were quickly responded to and she booked reservations for the Accademia for us. She gave us good directions to walk from the train station, about 10 minutes. The elevator was broken on our arrival so I had to carry our luggage up 3 flights of dark stairs. Not a big deal for me but it could be a problem for older folks. Doreen could not have been nicer. She showed us to our room and gave us a map. I ask for dinner ideas and she gladly suggested a few places and showed us on the map thier location. They turned out to be wonderful places with good value. The room was fine and the bathroom was very nice. The elevator worked the next 3 days, The location could not have been any better. 3 minutes to the Arno, 5 minutes to Duomo, 7 minutes to the Ponte Vehicco and Uffitzi. Now the bad news. With no Air conditioning and warm weather, we had to sleep with the windows open, that does not bother me but the noise from outside was so loud and lasted well into the wee hours of the morning. Not just a little noise but there is a parking garage right below our room and between the attendant talking to his friends, cars and motercycles, there must have been a restaurant somewhere below because they were rolling carts of dishes all night long and with the cobblestone streets, that was a loud mix. Thanks godness I had ear plugs that helped and I am not a light sleeper. Just be warned about the noise. Too bad Doreen has no control over this because otherwise it would have been great. She made you feel at home and insisted we call her for anything we needed and I felt she truely meant it. I would stay there again if the weather was cooler so we could close the windows
Reviews.Author: dillardr

Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a great location Hotel Scoti is a jewel in the heart of Florence. It's on the 5th Avenue of Florence, and is about a 5-minute walk from the Duomo, the number one attraction. Everything else is within a 20-minute walk.The hotel is located on the 2nd floor, and there is a lift. The room was big and very clean. The owner Doreen is very nice and accomodating. I would recommend getting the 5 euro breakfast - you get a lot for your money! The only downside was it was a bit noisy at night.I did a lot of research before I booked a hotel in Florence, and I did well with this one. I would absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Florence. It is not expensive, and it's in a good location.
Reviews.Author: AdrianaToronto

Reviews.Content: Friendly, clean, but certainly NOT quiet After reading the reviews on tripadvisor, my girlfriend and I stayed here for one night in mid-April. Great location, excellent staff (Doreen certainly was friendly and gave us great advice), very clean, great ambiance, awesome price, etc...However, we had a horrible experience with noise the night we stayed there. I'm hesitant to diss the place, but I don't know if we'll stay there again. It certainly was quiet at night, but the morning was a different story. We could hear EVERYTHING in the room next to us, from sneezes and coughs to conversation and weird bathroom noises that I'd rather not try to distinguish. The people next to us woke up at around 6 a.m. and took about 90 minutes to get ready, and I swear I felt like I was acutally in their room. The walls between our room and their bathroom were amazingly thin, and it honestly sounded like they were taking a shower in our room. Again, the place was great, and maybe we just had a bad room/neighbors, but I got so frustrated that I woke up at 6:30 a.m., took a shower of my own because I couldn't sleep from all the noise and then slept for another hour after the people next to us left. Did no one else have this experience???
Reviews.Author: irishrep

Reviews.Content: Expect T.L.C. at the Scoti If you are looking for a clean, comfortable, quiet, and affordable room in Florence. I heartily recommend the Hotel Scoti. The room was a nice size; the bathroom recently updated with plenty of hot water; beds were comfortable and clean. Also, the sitting room of the hotel is beautiful; 17th century frescos, lovely furnishings, and a large chandalier. There was no phone in the room, but we were able to use the hotel phone if we needed one. What made the Hotel Scoti so exceptional, though, was the owners. Doreen is a gracious hostess, and she speaks fluent English. Breakfast, for only an additional 5 euro a day per person, was brought to the room at a time we chose. I am a singer and was in Florence to perform. Doreen was very sweet to bring me hot tea before my concerts. When we went to Bologna for a performance, she let us keep some of our baggage at the Scoti so we wouldn't have to drag it all with us. She really made our stay in Florence a special one.The hotel is within comfortable walking distance from/to the train station (about 10 min.)and to major sites and exhibits in Florence. Look for two giant wooden doors directly across the street from Cartier's. Enter the large foyer and take the lift to the second floor.I'm sure Doreen will greet you with a smile.I just hope we will be able to book a room at the Hotel Scoti the next time we return to Florence.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: Great place to stay This small hotel is a great find in the heart of Florence. I stayed here on a visit to Florence last April with my mum and it was ideal for us. It is a short walk from the train station but we had been given good directions and found it easily enough. When we arrived the owner Doreen gave us a warm welcome and was so helpful with recommending local restaurants etc. The location is perfect as it's within walking distance from the main shopping/tourist areas. The room was a good size and very clean. Breakfast is served on a tray in your room and is quite basic but there is always plenty of it. I would definately stay there again!
Reviews.Author: Rozie

Reviews.Content: Romantic Hotel Scoti Location absolutely perfect - two minutes walk from River Arno and no more than 15 minutes from all the major attractions. Our room was quite small but we loved it. The bed was so comfortable, the bathroom was new and spotless - great shower. Very quiet room and very romantic with shutters and full length voiles. The owner, Doreen couldn't have been more friendly and helpful.
